results_summary: Grid is disconnected by opening CB1 at t=5.5 s (Sec. 4.1) causing GFCs to supply both local loads and full 13-bus MG load; overload engages DC-source saturation model (Eq. 3) and AC current limit model (Eq. 7). Under MG load 5.942 MVA at 0.97 pf + local load 0.375 MW per GFC, droop-only becomes unstable after t=5.5 s with DC current hitting i_d^max (Figs. 9–11); PINN+droop stabilizes and avoids i_d reaching i_d^max (Figs. 12–14). Reported: peak voltage deviation transient reduced by 24.14% vs droop-only (Case study 2); stable up to MG load 6.197 MVA at 0.97 pf where both AC current limit and controlled DC current limit are reached (Case study 4, Figs. 18–19).
